result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Vernon Rios

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Vernon Rios in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey A Jaeger in court for Michael Vernon Rios.  Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Reading of Info waived; NG plea entered. Def in custody on Br 1 case 22CF245. Counsel req adj.
Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Michael Vernon Rios in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey A Jaeger in court for Michael Vernon Rios.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def waives preim.  Court questions def, accepts waiver and binds def over; State to file Information.
Arraignment scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Clerk advised SPD by email of def needing counsel to be appointed.

Defendant Michael Vernon Rios in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court takes judicial notice of Case 22CF245 (Br 1), where Atty Leech has been privately retained.  Def indicates SPD stated they would be appointing counsel for this case.  Def motions to modify bond to cash; State objects.  Court denies request and keeps bond as previously set.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:15 am.
No contact with Wash. Co. Walmart Stores.

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Vernon Rios in court, in custody. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Def is in custody on cash bond in Br 1 case.  Court sets $1500 signature bond. Def referred to SPD (slip provided).  Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts.   Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing and to appear w/an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Initial appearance on August 1, 2022 at 08:15 am.
